title: Ethereum (ETH) Supply In Deflation, As Circulation Has Decreased Every Day So Far In 2023 - The Dales Report
summary: Ethereum's (ETH) supply has entered deflation as the circulation of the cryptocurrency has decreased every day in 2023, with a total reduction of 52 days. The Ethereum blockchain's proof-of-stake (PoS) consensus has led to a reduction in supply, and the implementation of EIP-1559 has burned a total of 2,928,514 ETH since its implementation in August 2021. The reduced supply is intended to prop up the value of ETH, opposite to the inflationary monetary policy of fiat currency systems. This differs from Bitcoin (BTC), which has a rising supply of mined BTC, although at some point in the future, mined supply will reach zero.

title: Ethereum price rally hit crucial resistance as institutional investors are in 'wait and see' mode - Cointelegraph
summary: Ethereum price rally hit crucial resistance as institutional investors are in 'wait and see' mode. Despite a 42.8% increase in Ether (ETH) since the start of 2023, the rally has paused at a crucial bull-bear pivot point. On-chain and technical analysis suggests that Ether bulls failed to overcome resistance at 0.082 Bitcoin (BTC) and are now consolidating below the $2,000 price level. Institutional investors are hesitant to invest in Ether due to regulatory clarity and scalability challenges, and the exuberant gas fees on Ethereum are limiting mass adoption.

title: Machine learning algorithm sets Ethereum price for March 1, 2023 - Finbold - Finance in Bold
summary:
Sure, here's a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

Machine learning algorithm predicts Ethereum price of $1,747 by March 1, 2023.

Current Ethereum price is $1,694, up 0.13% in the last 24 hours and 12.4% in the previous week.

Ethereum sentiment is generally positive on TradingView, with oscillators pointing towards 'neutral' and moving averages in the 'buy' zone.

Disclaimer: Investing is speculative and carries risk.

title: Crypto Miner Hive Blockchain Posts Q3 Loss as Ethereum Merge Cuts Revenue, Mining Margin - CoinDesk
summary: Hive Blockchain, a Vancouver-based crypto miner, reported a Q3 loss of US$90 million due to lower crypto prices and impairment of mining rigs and chips. Net loss per share was $1.09, compared to profit of $51.2 million in the same period last year. This is a reversal from the previous three months when the company had a loss of US$37 million.

title: Arbitrum Dominates Ethereum Layer-2: Daily Transactions and Volume Hit New Highs - DailyCoin
summary: Arbitrum, an Ethereum Layer-2 scaling solution, has experienced a surge in activity on its network, with daily transactions and volume reaching new highs. In the past week, Arbitrum processed 927,023 transactions, almost matching Ethereum's 1,059,640 transactions on the same day. Additionally, Arbitrum saw $2.7 billion in weekly volume, with $502.22 million flowing through DEXs on February 16, a daily high for the network.

title: Ethereum derivatives data suggests $1,700 might not remain a resistance level for long - Cointelegraph
summary: Ethereum derivatives data suggests that the $1,700 resistance level may not hold for long, despite recent price improvements. Investors are concerned about regulatory pressure, but there has been some positive developments in China. Ether derivatives metrics remain neutral-to-bullish, with higher demand for leverage longs and a decrease in demand for leverage shorts. The 25% delta skew indicator has moved away from bearish sentiment, indicating similar upside and downside risk appetite. Overall, the odds favor Ether bulls, but investors should conduct their own research and be aware of the risks involved in any investment or trading move.

title: Ethereum Price Revisits Key Range Support With Risk of More Downsides - TradingView
summary: Ethereum price is trading below $1,680 and the 100 hourly simple moving average after failing to clear the $1,720 resistance. The price corrected lower and is at risk of more losses below $1,620. Technical indicators, such as the MACD and RSI, are losing momentum in the bearish zone. Major support is at $1,620, while major resistance is at $1,685. A break below $1,600 could lead to further declines towards $1,535 or $1,500.

title: The Wait is Finally Over, CRYPT Token to be Launched on Ethereum Blockchain - GlobeNewswire
summary: The Crypter project is launching its CRYPT token on the Ethereum blockchain on February 24, 2023, after a successful launch on Binance Smart Chain in 2021. The token aims to provide a social media platform exclusively for crypto enthusiasts, with features such as live utilities, NFT marketplace, and staking. The project has already gained significant attention and has a current market capitalization of $58 million with nearly 15,000 users. Crypter Pay offers a state-of-the-art online payment channel for businesses, and Chain Quest is a play-to-earn game that will use Crypter tokens within its ecosystem. The project has a strong online presence and encourages potential investors to visit its official website, Twitter, Telegram, Discord, Instagram, or Facebook for more information. (Token launch date: February 24, 2023)

title: Solana (SOL): Native scalability - Coinbase
summary:
Solana (SOL) is a blockchain that has been gaining popularity due to its high transaction capacity and low fees. In this summary, we will discuss the current state of Solana, including its native scalability, competitive landscape, developer activity, and key protocol initiatives.

Native Scalability: Solana's unique proof-of-stake (PoS) consensus mechanism, combined with a timestamping function called proof-of-history (PoH), allows it to process up to 65,000 transactions per second (TPS). This is significantly higher than many other blockchains, including Ethereum, which has been forced to scale its network through second- and third-layers.

Competitive Landscape: Solana has been facing challenges due to the recent collapse of FTX, which had invested heavily in the platform. However, the network's historical association with FTX has contributed to a decline in its value and perception. Despite this, Solana has maintained a focus on improving its resiliency and infrastructure, implementing upgrades to reduce spam transactions and eliminate network outages.

Developer Activity

title: Friendsies NFT Collection Rug Pulled After Raising $5 Million - Ethereum World News
summary: Friendsies NFT collection, which raised $5 million at Christie’s auction on OpenSea last year, has been abruptly shut down by its founders. The project's Twitter account was deleted, and the founders blamed market volatility and challenges for their decision. The project's IP is now up for grabs, with Mastercard Product Lead Satvik Sethi offering to take over and find a new direction for the collection. The rug pull has caused uproar in the NFT community, with many victims calling out crypto influencers who aggressively promoted the collection last year.

title: Cronos and Its Top 4 Bridges - Altcoin Buzz
summary:
Sure, here's a summary of the article in 256 tokens or less:

Cronos is a layer 1 blockchain built on Cosmos, connecting EVM chains to the Cosmos ecosystem. It has four bridging options: Cronos Bridge, Multichain, XY Finance, and Cosmos IBC Hub. These bridges allow for the transfer of digital assets between different blockchains, including Crypto.org, Cosmos, Akash, and Cronos. The Cronos Bridge is a decentralized bridge built on IBC and Gravity Bridge, while Multichain connects over 70 chains, including Cronos, and XY Finance aggregates DEXes and bridges. Cosmos IBC Hub allows for the transfer of ATOM token across different chains, including Cronos.

title: Cryptocurrency price in India 21 February 2023: Bitcoin increases 2%, Ethereum up by 1%, meme coins mark gain - India Today
summary:
Here is a summary of the financial news in less than 256 tokens:

Cryptocurrency prices in India saw gains on Tuesday, with Bitcoin up 2%, Ethereum up 1%, and meme coins marking gains. The global crypto market cap increased by 1.36%, while the total crypto market volume fell by 0.21%. Top gainers included Conflux, Neo, Klaytn, and Huobi Token, while top losers included Monero, Rocket Pool, Filecoin, and Blur. Meme coins like Shiba Inu, Dogecoin, and Bone ShibaSwap saw price increases, and metaverse tokens ApeCoin, Axie Infinity, and Decentraland also saw gains.

title: Blur to Airdrop $300M In Extra Tokens to 'Loyal' NFT Traders - Decrypt
summary: Blur, an NFT marketplace, is airdropping $300M worth of additional tokens to loyal users. The platform's native token, BLUR, will be distributed to traders based on their interaction with the platform and their commitment to using only Blur for NFT transactions. The more users interact with Blur, the higher their loyalty score and the more BLUR tokens they will receive. The airdrop is part of Blur's "Season 2" program and is intended to further incentivize users to use the platform. The move comes as Blur has overtaken OpenSea as the most popular Ethereum NFT trading platform, and as the NFT market continues to grow, the competition between platforms is expected to intensify.

title: Here Are 7 of the Best Ethereum Alternatives to Buy in 2023 - Outlook India
summary: Investors looking to diversify their Ethereum holdings can consider these 7 alternatives in 2023: C+Charge provides transparency to the EV charging industry, making it easier for drivers to find and compare charging stations and prices.

title: Algorand among the best Layer 1 blockchains - The Cryptonomist
summary: Algorand, a layer 1 blockchain, has been ranked third among its competitors in terms of speed, with the ability to process 20 TPS every 4.5 seconds and a total of 1,200 TPS with instantaneous finality. Algorand's PPOS (Pure Proof-of-Stake) consensus algorithm and use of AWS for scaling have made it more scalable than classical PoS protocols. However, the company faces the same challenge as Avalanche and Cardano in managing its own keys, which can lead to problems with wallets. Despite this, Algorand has been able to attract institutional investors due to its certification of components. The token's value has been on a downward trend since November 2021, but some analysts believe it may be due for a correction and could potentially target $0.410.
